Uses of Class
xxl.core.io.Block

Packages that use Block
xxl.core.collections.containers.io Provides some containers that are able to store their blocks on disk. 
xxl.core.collections.containers.recordManager Provides a decorator container that is able to store records (of type Block ) which are of different size. 
xxl.core.collections.queues.io The package xxl.core.collections.queues.io provides some implementations of the queue datastructure using special containers (BlockBasedQueue), files (FileStackQueue) or streams (StreamQueue) for storing and receiving the data. 
xxl.core.io Provides classes and routines for system input and output through data streams, serialization, raw i/o and a FAT file system.

Methods in xxl.core.collections.containers.io that return Block
protected  Block MultiBlockContainer.getLogicalBlock(java.util.List blockList, int size)
          Returns the logical block that is given by the specified list of physical blocks.
 

Methods in xxl.core.collections.containers.io with parameters of type Block
protected  java.lang.Long MultiBlockContainer.getId(Block block)
          Returns the id of the next block in the linked list of physical block that is stored in the specified block.
protected  java.util.List MultiBlockContainer.getPhysicalBlocks(Block logicalBlock)
          Returns a list of physical blocks that represent the specified logical block.
protected  int MultiBlockContainer.setId(Block block, java.lang.Object id)
          Sets the id stored in the specified block to the specified object and returns the number of bytes that are taken by the converted id.

Uses of Block in xxl.core.io
 

Fields in xxl.core.io declared as Block
protected  Block BufferedOutputStream.block
          The block that is actually used for storing the bytes that are written to the output stream.
 

Methods in xxl.core.io that return Block
 Block BlockFactory.allocate()
          Allocates and returns a new block on the underlying array.
 Block Block.compress()
          Compresses (zips) the current Block and returns the compressed Block.
 Block Block.decompress()
          Uncompresses (unzips) the current Block and returns the original Block.
